English: Ooh, this place looks nice! *drool*
Chinese:
這間店的東西感覺好好吃哦……
我口水都流下來了。
Korean:
이 가게 맛있어 보이네…
츄르르르릅
German: Ach, hier ist es aber nett! *Sabber*

English:
...Ah!
...Who the hell are you!?
Chinese:
啊！
你是什麼人？
Korean:
…핫!
……당신은 대체?
German:
... Ah!
... Wer zum Teufel bist denn du?!

English:
Huh? If you want to eat, just come inside, did you
say? You don't understand!
Chinese:
咦？　既然想吃幹嘛不進去？
你真是什麼都不懂啊。
Korean:
네? 먹고 싶으면 들어가면 된다고요?
당신, 아무것도 모르는군요
German:
Was? Wenn du essen willst, komm einfach rein?
Du verstehst das nicht!

English:
A lady such as myself can't simply go into a place
such as this unaccompanied!
Chinese: 淑女是很難一個人走進這種店家的！
Korean:
레이디는 이런 가게에
혼자서는 좀처럼 못 들어가는 법이라고요!
German:
Eine Dame wie ich kann nicht einfach ohne
Begleitung an so einen Ort gehen!

English:
...By the way, the other day I saw a girl left
alone outside this place. She looked so lonely...
Chinese:
說到這個，之前也有一個站在店門口，
一臉落寞地偷看著店內的孩子呢。
Korean:
…그러고 보니 요전에도
가게 앞에서 어쩐지 쓸쓸하게 가게 안을 엿보던 아이가 있었죠
German:
Neulich habe ich übrigens ein Mädchen gesehen,
das hier draußen rumstand. Sie wirkte so einsam.

English:
She was fair-skinned and had black hair...
She was looking at the display...
Chinese: 白皮膚、黑頭髮，一直盯著店家的櫥窗看……
Korean: 피부가 하얗고 흑발에, 가게 디스플레이를 계속 바라보고 있었는데…
German:
Sie war hellhäutig und hatte schwarze Haare ...
Sie sah sich das Angebot an ...

English:
Perhaps...
Perhaps only I saw the girl...?
Chinese:
那個該不會……
只有我看得到之類的？
Korean:
설마 그건…
저한테만 보인다던가?
German:
Vielleicht ...
Vielleicht habe nur ich das Mädchen gesehen ...?

English: Aaaaahhh!!!
Chinese: 呀啊啊啊————！！
German: Aaahhh!

English:
So [p], how's the new body?
Have you broken it in yet?
Chinese:
[p]，新身體的狀況怎麼樣？
“散步”散得還順利嗎？
Korean:
[p], 새로운 몸의 상태는 어떻지?
"산책"은 순조롭나?
German:
Na, [p], wie geht es dir mit deinem neuen Körper?
Hast du dich schon daran gewöhnt?

English:
While you were out having fun, we got another
request for the Cyber Sleuth.
Chinese:
不好意思打斷你，
有件委託想拜託你這位電腦偵探。
Korean:
즐거운 와중에 미안하지만
전뇌탐정으로서의 네게 부탁하고 싶은 의뢰가 있다
German:
Während du unterwegs warst, kam ein neuer Auftrag
für den Cyber-Detektiv rein.

English: It's quite a big, complex case.
Chinese: 是一件份量大又多的委託喔。
Korean: 꽤 볼륨이 있는 무거운 의뢰야
German: Es ist ein ziemlich großer, komplexer Fall.

English:
Once you get back to the office, you can find the
case on the white board.
Chinese:
你先回事務所一趟，
確認一下委託用的白板吧。
Korean:
한 번 사무소로 돌아와서
의뢰용 화이트보드를 확인해보도록
German:
Wenn du wieder im Büro bist, findest du den Fall
am Schwarzen Brett.

English:
She was fair-skinned and had black hair...
That girl, she was a ghost!?
Chinese:
白皮膚、黑頭髮，一直盯著店家的櫥窗看……
那時候看到的孩子果然是鬼嗎！？
Korean:
피부가 하얗고 흑발에 가게 디스플레이를 계속 바라보는…
그때 본 아이, 역시 귀신!?
German:
Sie war hellhäutig und hatte schwarze Haare ...
Dieses Mädchen, war das ein Geist?!

English:
[p]
I know it's out of the blue, but...
Chinese: [p]，雖然這麼問很突然……
Korean: [p], 갑자기 미안하지만…
German:
[p], ich weiß, das kommt jetzt aus heiterem
Himmel, aber ...

English: Are you hungry right now?
Chinese: 你現在肚子餓不餓？
Korean: 너는 지금 배가 고픈가?
German: Hast du gerade Hunger?

English:
Yes, starving!
Sort of.
I'm stuffed!
Chinese:
餓死了！
五分餓吧？
撐死了……
Korean:
배고파요!
배고프기 직전인 느낌?
만땅…이에요
German:
Ja, ich bin am Verhungern!
Ein bisschen.
Ich bin so voll!

English:
Hahahaha...
Kids your age are always hungry!
Chinese:
哈哈哈哈哈，這樣啊。
我就知道你這個年紀的孩子總是處在飢餓狀態。
Korean:
핫핫핫핫하, 그런가 그렇군
네 또래의 아이는 항상 배가 고플 거라고 생각했어
German:
Hahaha ...
In deinem Alter hat man immer Hunger!

English:
...Actually, this case came from the Web.
It's quite a strange one.
Chinese:
這次的委託是從網路上發過來的，
內容還挺奇妙的。
Korean:
…실은 이번 의뢰는
WEB 상으로 온 꽤나 기묘한 안건인데 말이다
German:
Dieser Fall stammt übrigens aus dem Netz.
Er ist etwas seltsam.

English:
We have a request from someone who ranks gourmet
restaurants as a personal hobby.
Chinese:
有個私人興趣經營的美食排名「愛吃榜」，
委託是來自那裡的一位匿名評審員。
Korean:
개인 취미로 하고 있다는 맛집 랭킹
「취미 랭킹」의 복면 심사원인 인물의 의뢰인데
German:
Wir haben eine Anfrage von einer Person, die
hobbymäßig Gourmet-Restaurants bewertet.

English:
She would like you to go to Nakano and grade the
gourmet restaurants there and report back to her.
Chinese:
他好像希望你去調查一下中野的美食，
然後幫他記錄食記和評分。
Korean:
나카노의 맛집을 체크해서
맛에 대한 감상과 채점 대행을 해주길 바란다고 한다
German:
Sie möchte, dass du nach Nakano gehst, die
Gourmet-Restaurants dort für sie bewertest
und ihr dann Bericht erstattest.

English:
The fees and expenses have all been paid upfront.
I decided it wasn't a risk, so I took it on.
Chinese:
委託人已經先支付報酬和經費了。
反正也不是什麼大案件，所以我判斷接下來也不會有損失。
Korean:
보수와 경비를 선불로 지불해줘서 말이지
큰 안건도 아니니 받아들여도 손해는 아니라고 판단했다
German:
Das Honorar und jegliche Kosten wurden schon
bezahlt. Ich dachte mir, dass der Fall nicht
riskant ist, also habe ich ihn angenommen.

English:
...I have decided to entrust this case to "you
guys."
Chinese: 這個案件想交給“你們”處理。
Korean: …이 안건을 "너희들"에게 맡기고 싶다
German:
Ich habe beschlossen, „euch Jungspunden“
diesen Fall anzuvertrauen.

English:
Kyoko, is that Egg and Rice place really doing
all-you-can-eat buffets now!?
Chinese: 杏子姊，你說可以生蛋拌飯吃到飽是真的嗎！？
Korean: 쿄코 씨, GGB(계란간장밥)을 마음껏 먹어도 된다는 거 정말이야!?
German:
Kyoko, gibt es in dem TKG-Restaurant wirklich
Büffets, bei denen man so viel essen kann,
wie man will?!

English: Can I really eat for free, Kyoko?
Chinese: 真的可以吃免錢飯嗎？杏子姊。
Korean: 진짜 공짜로 먹어도 되는 거지, 쿄코 씨?
German: Kann ich wirklich kostenlos essen, Kyoko?

English:
...Yes, it's a present from me to all you hungry
little kids.
Chinese:
沒什麼啦，這是我給空腹年輕人的
一點小心意。
Korean:
…뭘, 배고픈 젊은이들에게
내가 주는 팁이다
German: Ja, das ist mein Geschenk an euch hungrige Kids.

English: Please, try your best on this one.
Chinese: 你們就去徹底調查一番吧。
Korean: 마음껏 조사하도록
German: Bitte gebt euer Bestes.

English:
Actually, I wish I could accompany you, but I've
decided to leave this up to your young stomachs.
Chinese:
其實我本來也想同行的，
但後來還是決定交給年輕人的胃袋。
Korean:
실은 나도 동행하고 싶지만
이건 청년들의 위장에 맡기도록 하지
German:
Eigentlich würde ich gern mitkommen, aber ich habe
beschlossen, das euren jungen Bäuchen zu
überlassen.

English: Enjoy Nakano's finest gourmet restaurants!
Chinese: 去好好享受中野的美食吧。
Korean: 나카노의 미식 투어를 만끽하고 오도록
German:
Viel Spaß mit den besten Gourmet-Restaurants in
Nakano!

English:
So, the three restaurants we are going to are a
Chinese restaurant, a sushi restaurant, and a
teahouse.
Chinese:
要調查的店家有三間，
「中式餐廳」、「壽司店」、「輕食咖啡館」……
Korean:
조사 대상인 가게는 3곳
「중화요리 가게」,「초밥집」,「경식찻집」인가…
German:
Wir besuchen drei Restaurants: ein chinesisches,
eins für Sushi und ein Teehaus.

English: Wait...what about the Egg and Rice place?
Chinese: 奇怪……哪裡可以吃到生蛋拌飯？
Korean: 어라… GGB는 어디서 먹을 수 있는 거야?
German: Moment ... Was ist mit dem TKG-Restaurant?

English:
It looks like each one of these places is in the
Nakano building.
Chinese: 這三家店好像都在這間中野館裡面。
Korean: 어떤 가게도 이 나카노 관내에 있는 가게 같군
German: Die Restaurants sind alle im Nakano-Gebäude.

English: Aww...what about the Egg and Rice place?
Chinese: ……我說啊，哪裡可以吃到生蛋拌飯？
Korean: …저기, GGB는 어디서 먹을 수 있어?
German: Och ... Was ist mit dem TKG-Restaurant?

English:
We can visit the places in any order.
I'm starving, let's just go!
Chinese:
從哪家開始好像沒有太大的不同。
肚子也餓了，我們快走吧！
Korean:
어디부터 돌아도 큰 차이는 없을 것 같네
배도 고프니 빨리 가자!
German:
Es ist egal, in welcher Reihenfolge wir sie
besuchen. Ich habe Hunger. Auf geht’s!

English: But...my Egg and Rice...
Chinese: 喂……我的生蛋拌飯呢！？
Korean: 잠깐… 내 GGB는!?
German: Aber ... ich wollte so gern Reis mit Ei ...

English: Huh? What restaurant is this?
Chinese: 咦？這家店是怎樣……
Korean: 어? 뭐야, 이 가게…
German: Hoppla? Was für ein Restaurant ist das?

English:
This place is kind of run down...actually, it's
falling apart. Actually, no, it's a complete dump!
Chinese:
怎麼感覺有點破爛……
很破爛，超級破爛……
Korean:
뭔가 좀 낡았달까…
오래됐달까 너덜너덜하달까…
German:
Das Restaurant ist heruntergekommen ...
Eine einzige Ruine. Ach, nein,
es ist ein totaler Saftladen!

English:
You must be blind...
This place looks great!
Chinese:
妳真是沒眼光啊……
就是這種店才越能吃到好東西哦？
Korean:
댁은 보는 눈이 없구만…
이런 가게야말로 더 맛있다고?
German:
Du hast wohl Tomaten auf den Augen ...
Ich finde, es sieht toll aus!

English:
If it's been deteriorating it means it's been here
for a long time, which means customers have been
coming here for a long time which means it's good!
Chinese:
變破爛表示這家店在這裡很久了，
在這裡很久了表示長年受到大家的喜愛。
Korean:
낡았다는 건 오랫동안 여기서 장사를 했다는 것
오랫동안 장사를 했다는 건 오랫동안 사랑받았다는 뜻이야
German:
Wenn es in schlechtem Zustand ist, heißt das, dass
es schon lange hier ist, weil schon lange Kunden
herkommen, was bedeutet, dass es gut ist!

English:
Great, let's go in!
[p], what are you having?
Chinese:
好，我們進去吧！
……[p]，你要點什麼？
Korean:
자, 안으로 들어가자!
…[p], 댁은 뭘 시킬 거야?
German:
Also gut, gehen wir rein!
[p], was willst du?

English: (Hmm...what should I have...)
Chinese: （要點什麼好呢……）
Korean: (그럼 뭘 주문할까…)
German: (Hmmm ... Worauf habe ich Lust ...)

English:
(The Chahan looks good,
but so does the Mapo Doufu.)
Chinese:
（想點炒飯，
　但中菜的王道——麻婆豆腐也很難割捨。）
Korean:
(볶음밥도 먹고 싶지만
역시 중화요리의 왕도인 마파두부도 먹고 싶다)
German:
(Das Chahan sieht gut aus,
aber das Mapo Doufu auch.)

English:
(...Huh? Half a Chahan meal? Hmm...that way I
could just have the parts of the Chahan I like the
best... Okay, I'll go for that, then.)
Chinese:
（嗯？半份炒飯套餐？
　炒飯加一道任選菜色……好，就是這個了吧。）
Korean:
(…응? 반 볶음밥 세트?
볶음밥과 좋아하는 일품요리인가… 좋아, 이것밖엔 없지)
German:
(... Was? Ein halbes Chahan-Gericht? Hmmm ...
So könnte ich nur das Beste am Chahan essen.
Okay, so mache ich es.)

English: Half a Chahan and a Mapo Doufu, here you are!
Chinese: 您的半份炒飯和麻婆豆腐，久等了！
Korean: ―반 볶음밥과 마파두부, 기다리셨슴다!
German: Ein halbes Chahan und Mapo Doufu, bitte!

English:
(Wow, they give good-sized portions here...
This was a good choice!)
Chinese:
（份量還挺多的。
　不是我要自誇，但我還真是點對了。）
Korean:
(이건 꽤 볼륨이 있다
내가 했지만 나이스 초이스였던 것 같다)
German:
(Wow, die Portionen hier sind wirklich groß ...
Gut, dass wir hergekommen sind!)

English:
(...Huh? That delicious smell...
Ah, yes, it's the Sichuan pepper in
the Mapo Doufu... mmm...)
Chinese:
（嗯？這個香味是……
　原來是加在麻婆豆腐裡的花椒啊……我嚐嚐。）
Korean:
(…응? 이 좋은 향기는…
그렇구나, 마파두부에 들어간 산초 냄새인가… 어디)
German:
(... Oha? Das riecht so lecker ...
Ach, das ist der Szechuanpfeffer im Mapo Doufu ...
Mmmh ...)

English:
(Oh! The Sichuan pepper is making a beautiful
harmony with the even more delicious star anise!)
Chinese:
（喔喔！刺激鼻腔的花椒與味道適中的八角
　絕妙和諧地搭配在一起！）
Korean:
(오오! 코로 느끼는 산초의 향과 적당한 팔각의 풍미가
매우 절묘한 하모니를 자아내고 있어!)
German:
(Ah! Der Szechuanpfeffer harmoniert herrlich mit
dem noch köstlicheren Sternanis!)

English:
(I'm gonna try and put the Chahan in my mouth
while the aftertaste of the Mapo Doufu is still
there...)
Chinese:
（好，趁嘴巴裡還留著麻婆豆腐的餘味
　緊接著吃一口炒飯——）
Korean:
(그럼 이 마파두부의 여운이 남아있는 동안에
입 안에 볶음밥을 넣고, 그리고―)
German:
(Ich werde das Chahan kosten,
während ich noch den Nachgeschmack des
Mapo Doufu im Mund habe ...)

English: That was great!
Chinese: 多謝款待。
Korean: 잘 먹었습니다
German: Das war toll!

English:
Ohh, that was delicious!
Just like I thought, this place is amazing!
Chinese:
呼～吃得好飽啊。
果然被我料中了，這家店口味挺好的。
Korean:
후―, 잘 먹었다
역시 내가 생각한 대로 꽤 맛있는 가게였어
German:
Ach, das war köstlich!
Dieser Laden ist so gut, wie ich es erwartet
hatte!

English:
That was great! Crab omelet and egg Chahan with
stir-fried mushroom and egg!
Chinese:
天津飯、蛋炒飯還有黑木耳炒蛋
都好好吃喔！
Korean:
맛있었네!
텐신한이랑 계란볶음밥이랑 목이버섯 계란 볶음!
German:
Das war lecker! Krabbenomelett und Eier-Chahan
mit gebratenen Pilzen und Ei!

English: Who are you?
Chinese: 妳是……
Korean: 너는…
German: Wer bist du?

English:
Hey, what are you doing?
...Come on, let's go!
Chinese:
喂，怎麼了，
我們快走吧。
Korean:
어이, 왜 그래
…빨리 가자
German:
He, was soll das?
... Los, gehen wir!

English: Uh, yes..
Chinese: 喔、好……
Korean: 으, 응…
German: Äh, ja ...

English:
I'm coming, I'm coming!
The sushi restaurant is next!
SSSUUUUSSSSHHHHHIIIII!!!
Chinese:
來啦來啦來啦！　壽司店！
壽、司、店——！！
Korean:
왔다왔다왔다왔다! 초밥집!
초 오 바 압 집이다아아―――!!
German:
Ich komme ja schon!
Als Nächstes ist das Sushi-Restaurant dran!
SSSUUUUSSSSHHHHHIIIII!

English: What's up? You seem tense.
Chinese: 幹嘛啦……妳怎麼那麼激動。
Korean: 뭐야… 꽤 텐션이 높잖아
German: Was ist los? Du wirkst so angespannt.

English:
Because!!! It's a sushi restaurant where the food
doesn't come 'round on a conveyor belt!
I've never seen that before!
Chinese:
那還用說！　因為這不是迴轉壽司呀？
我有生以來第一次吃不是迴轉的壽司店！
Korean:
그치만 그치만 그치만! 빙글빙글 돌지 않는 초밥집인걸?
돌지 않는 초밥집이라니 나 태어나서 처음이야!
German:
Warum? Es ist ein Sushi-Restaurant, wo
man sich das Essen nicht von einem Band nehmen
kann! So was habe ich noch nie gesehen!

English: ...Awww, that's so sad!
Chinese:
這樣啊……
感覺有點可憐呢。
Korean:
…그렇구나
그건 안됐네
German: ... Och, wie traurig!

English:
Uh, wha...what!?
Are...are you making fun of me now!?
Have you ever been to a fancy sushi place?
Chinese:
怎、怎樣啦！　你、你剛才笑我對不對！？
那你就有來過這種壽司店嗎？
Korean:
잠깐, 뭐, 뭐야! …지, 지금 바보취급 했지!?
그러는 아라타는 와본 적 있어?
German:
Äh, wa-was?!
Machst du dich über mich lustig?!
Warst du schon in einem edlen Sushi-Restaurant?

English:
...Moving on...
What do you want to eat?
Chinese:
這不重要啦……
妳有什麼想吃的壽司嗎？
Korean:
……그런 것보다
…너, 뭔가 먹고 싶은 재료 같은 거 있어?
German:
... Weiter im Text ...
Was willst du essen?

English:
Hmm...
Well, I'm definitely going for the omelet!
Chinese: 這個嘛……我想吃煎蛋的！
Korean: 그렇네… 나는 역시 계란이려나!
German:
Hmmm ...
Ich esse auf jeden Fall das Omelett!

English: Huh? The omelet?
Chinese: 什麼？　煎蛋？
Korean: 하아? 계란이라고오?
German: Was? Das Omelett?

English: Ugh... You don't get it at all!
Chinese: 妳真的什麼都不懂耶。
Korean: …역시 너는 아무것도 모르는구만
German: Ach ... Du kapierst es einfach nicht!

English: ...Huh?
Chinese: 咦？
German: ... Was?

English:
You know, egg was a desert a long time ago.
If you eat something sweet like that, you will
ruin your fish!
Chinese:
煎蛋在以前算是甜點。
吃了那麼甜的東西，其他配料的味道都吃不出來了。
Korean:
계란은 말이지, 옛날로 치면 디저트야
그런 단 것부터 먹었다간 재료의 맛을 모르게 되어버린다고
German:
Ei war früher mal eine Nachspeise.
Wenn du so etwas Süßes isst,
ruiniert das den Fischgeschmack!

English:
When you eat sushi, you should always start with
white fish.
Chinese: 吃壽司的法則就是要從白肉魚開始吃。
Korean: 스시는 흰 살 생선부터 먹는 게 철칙이야
German:
Wenn man Sushi isst, sollte man immer mit
Weißfisch beginnen.

English:
The way the experts do it is they eat clean-
tasting white fish first, then fattier fish, then
sushi rolls.
Chinese:
先從味道清淡的魚開始進攻，接著是油脂肥厚的魚，
最後再用壽司捲做結尾，才是饕客的吃法。
Korean:
깔끔한 맛의 생선부터 시작해서 기름진 생선,
그 후 말이로 마무리해서 먹는 법이야
German:
Kenner essen erst Weißfisch mit reinem Geschmack,
dann fettigeren Fisch und zuletzt Sushi-Rollen.

English:
Ugh... That's so boooring!
Jeez, no wonder you don't get any girls, you're
such a nerd!
Chinese:
總覺得……你好麻煩哦！
這麼計較不會受歡迎的，勸你還是改一改吧。
Korean:
…왠지 ……귀찮아!
그런 거 인기 없어지니까 그만두는 게 좋아
German:
Ach ... Wie laaangweilig!
Kein Wunder, dass Mädchen dich nicht mögen,
du bist ja so ein Nerd!

English:
Anyway, let's go inside!
[p], what are you going to start with?
Chinese:
總之我們進去吧！
[p]，你要從什麼開始吃起？
Korean:
아무튼 안으로 들어가자!
[p]는(은) 뭐부터 먹을 거야?
German:
Los, gehen wir rein!
[p], was bestellst du als Erstes?

English:
(Some people think they know everything about
sushi and keep going on and on about it, but the
best way to eat it is the way you like it.)
Chinese:
（雖然有人對壽司的吃法意見很多，
　不過還是照自己想吃的順序才是正確吃法。）
Korean:
(스시를 먹는 법에 대해 우쭐대며 늘어놓는 사람도 있지만
역시 내가 먹고 싶은 순서대로 먹는 게 올바른 먹는 방법이야)
German:
(Manche Leute denken, sie wissen alles über Sushi
und schwafeln endlos rum, aber am besten isst man
es einfach so, wie man es mag.)

English: (Hmm... Still, I can't decide...)
Chinese: （嗯……話說回來真令人猶豫啊……）
Korean: (으음―… 그렇다 해도 고민되네…)
German: (Hm, ich kann mich immer noch nicht entscheiden.)

English:
(At times like this, the best thing to do is to
look at the chef's recommendations...)
Chinese:
（通常這種時候都會從
　張貼在店內的本日特選開始吃起吧。）
Korean:
(이럴 때는 가게 안에 붙어 있는
그날의 특선 재료부터 먹는 게 정석이겠지)
German:
(Manchmal ist es am besten, sich die Empfehlungen
des Kochs anzusehen ...)

English:
(Oh, today's recommendation is squid?
...Okay, I'll start with that, then.)
Chinese:
（喔，今天的特選是近海日本魷啊……
　好，就從這個開始吃。）
Korean:
(헤에, 오늘은 근해에서 잡은 오징어가 추천인가…
좋아, 우선은 그것부터 가보자)
German:
(Ach, heute wird Tintenfisch empfohlen?
... Gut, dann fange ich damit an.)

English: Sure thing! One squid, comin' right up!
Chinese: 您的日本魷好了！
Korean: ―여기요! 오징어 한 접시!
German: Alles klar! Ein Tintenfisch! Kommt sofort!

English:
(Okay, they're putting the sushi on my plate...
You certainly don't get this kind of treatment at
a cheap conveyor belt sushi place...)
Chinese:
（剛捏好的壽司放在眼前的壽司木盤上……
　光這一點就是迴轉壽司享受不到的奢侈。）
Korean:
(갓 만든 스시가 눈앞의 스시 접시에 놓여 있다…
이것만으로도 회전초밥에는 없는 사치다)
German:
(Aha, sie legen das Sushi auf meinen Teller ...
Solchen Service erhält man in einem
billigen Lokal mit Sushi vom Band nicht ...)

English: (Now then...)
Chinese: （我瞧瞧……）
Korean: (그럼…)
German: (Los geht es ...)

English:
(Wow...it's plump, springy and thick...
It really looks delicious!)
Chinese:
（哇……肥美厚實又充滿彈性……
　這魷魚看起來是多麼地美味。）
Korean:
(호오… 통통하고 쫄깃하고 묵직한…
정말 맛있어 보이는 오징어잖아)
German:
(Wow ... Er ist dick und nicht zu zäh ...
Er sieht wirklich lecker aus!)

English:
(I'll just put some soy sauce on it and pop in my
mouth...)
Chinese: （將魷魚前端沾一點點醬油，一口氣放入嘴裡……）
Korean: (재료 끝에 간장을 약간 찍어서 단숨에 입안으로…）
German: (Ich würze ihn mit Sojasoße und koste ihn ...)

English: (Oh, that's amazing!)
Chinese: （嗯，好吃！）
Korean: (응, 맛있다!)
German: (Wow, das ist fantastisch!)

English:
(The squid is a little bland, but the al dente
texture and the unique taste compliment each other
beautifully!)
Chinese:
（魷魚本身味道清淡，不過吃起來硬硬的口感
以及獨特的風味在口中譜出了絕妙的協奏曲……）
Korean:
(오징어 자체는 담백하지만 이 꼬들꼬들한 촉감과
독특한 풍미가 입 안에서 절묘한 하모니를 연주하고 있어…)
German:
(Der Tintenfisch ist etwas fade, aber die Textur
ist al dente und passt gut zum einzigartigen
Geschmack!)

English:
(Okay, now that I have worked up an appetite, the
next one is...)
Chinese:
（很好，我的食慾全被勾起來了……
　接著下一個是——）
Korean:
(좋아, 괜찮은 느낌으로 식욕이 생겼다…
그럼 다음은―）
German:
(Jetzt, da ich Appetit bekommen habe, nehme ich
als Nächstes ...)

English: That was delicious!
Chinese: 多謝款待！
Korean: 잘 먹었습니다!
German: Das war köstlich!

English:
Uff! I'm stuffed!
That was absolutely delicious!
Chinese:
呼啊——吃得好飽哦！
果然很好吃呢！
Korean:
후아아―― 엄청 먹었다!
역시 맛있었네!
German:
Uff! Ich bin so voll!
Das war superlecker!

English:
Mmmm...so this is what an expensive sushi place is
like...
Chinese: 嗯……這就是非迴轉壽司的實力嗎……
Korean: 그래… 이게 돌지 않는 초밥의 실력인가…
German:
Mmmh ... So ist das also in einem teuren
Sushi-Restaurant ...

English: Huh? You...
Chinese: 咦？　我看你果然……
Korean: 어라? 너 역시…
German: Was? Du ...

English:
...You, you never knew what you were talking
about, did you!?
Chinese:
這、這不重要啦，
是說妳真的很沒品味耶。
Korean:
…그, 그런 것보다 댁
정말 센스가 없네
German:
... Du, du wusstest gar nicht, wovon du redest,
oder?!

English: Huh?
Chinese: 什麼？
Korean: 헤?
German: Was?

English: Well at least I didn't just order fish eggs!
Chinese:
為什麼妳不是點鮭魚卵就是飛魚卵，
還有鯡魚卵啊？
Korean:
댁은 왜 연어알이나 날치알이나 청어알 같은
그런 것들만 시키는 거야?
German: Wenigstens habe ich nicht bloß Fischeier bestellt!

English:
Everything you've ordered is eggs!
You're obsessed!
Chinese: 妳點的東西太集中在魚卵類了！
Korean: 치우쳐 있다고! 주문이!
German:
Du bestellst nichts außer Eiern!
Du bist völlig darauf fixiert!

English:
Also, when you left the restaurant, you said
"Oaisou," didn't you?
Chinese:
還有要離開店裡時，
妳說了「算帳」對不對？
Korean:
그리고 댁
가게를 나올 때「감삼다」이라고 했지?
German:
Und als du aus dem Restaurant gegangen bist, hast
du „Oaisou“ gesagt, nicht wahr?

English:
I just wanted to try it out once...
Is that not right?
Chinese: 因為我很想講一次看看啊……不好嗎？
Korean: 한번 말해보고 싶었는걸… 안되는 거야?
German:
Ich wollte es nur einmal probieren ...
War es falsch?

English:
"Oaisou" comes from the term "aisou wo tsukasu."
It is used only by the staff to talk to the
customers, never the other way around.
Chinese:
「算帳」是「計算帳目」的意思。
是店家使用的詞，而不是客人自己說的。
Korean:
「감삼다」이라는 건「찾아 주셔서 감사합니다」라는 의미야
가게 측이 손님에게 쓰는 말이지 손님이 하는 말이 아니라고
German:
„Oaisou“ kommt vom Ausdruck „aisou wo tsukasu“.
Das sagt nur die Bedienung zum Kunden,
nicht andersherum.

English:
...Hey, [p], wouldn't it
be best if you wrote the report?
Chinese:
[p]，之後的食記
可以拜託你寫吧？
Korean:
…저기 [p], 실제로 맛 감상을 쓰는 건
네게 부탁해도 괜찮지?
German:
... He, [p], wäre es nicht am besten,
wenn du den Bericht schreibst?

English:
Cool, that's great! That way I can focus on the
eating part!
Chinese:
這樣啊！　太好了！
因為我全副精神都集中在吃上面了！
Korean:
그렇구나! 다행이야!
나도 참, 먹는 것에만 집중해버려서 말야!
German:
Cool! Das ist super. Dann kann ich mich aufs
Essen konzentrieren!

English: Hey... Don't just ignore me!
Chinese:
喂，
不要無視我。
Korean:
…어이
……무시하지 마
German: He ... Ignorier mich nicht!

English:
...Uh, what?
I...I wasn't going to...
Chinese:
唔呃？
我、我沒有那個意思……
Korean:
…으, 아?
벼, 별로 난 그럴 생각이…
German:
... Äh, was?
Ich ... Ich wollte nicht ...

English: Okay, so you take the next place!
Chinese: 下一間店也麻煩你囉！
Korean: 다음 가게도 잘 부탁해!
German: Okay, du übernimmst das nächste Restaurant!

English:
Wow, this place sure does have a lot of menu
options for a teahouse!
Chinese:
喔，這裡就是輕食咖啡啊。
雖然是咖啡館，菜色種類卻挺多的。
Korean:
헤에, 여기가 경식찻집인가아
찻집인데도 여러 가지 메뉴가 있구나
German:
Wow, für ein Teehaus hat der Laden echt viele
Gerichte zur Auswahl!

English:
Curry, pancakes, salty mackerel set meal... Looks
like this place serves all kinds of food.
Chinese:
咖哩、鬆餅、鹽烤鯖魚定食……
這菜單還真混雜啊。
Korean:
카레에 핫케이크에 고등어 자반 정식…
그건 그렇고 일관성 없는 메뉴네
German:
Currygerichte, Pfannkuchen, ein Salzmakrelen-Menü.
In diesem Restaurant gibt es wohl alles Mögliche.

English: So, what are you having?
Chinese: 妳要點什麼？
Korean: 댁은 뭘 시킬 거야?
German: Also, was bestellst du?

English: Hmm....
Chinese: 這個嘛……
Korean: 그렇네에…
German: Hmmm ...

English:
Ah! They have an egg set meal! Free second
helping! This is the Egg and Rice place that Kyoko
said had an all-you-can-eat buffet!
Chinese:
啊！　生蛋拌飯定食！　免費續碗！
這就是杏子姊說的生蛋拌飯吃到飽啊！
Korean:
아! 간장계란밥 정식! 리필 무료!
이게 쿄코 씨가 말했던 GGB 무제한 리필이었구나아!
German:
Ah! Es gibt ein Eier-Menü! Zweite Portion gratis!
Dies ist das TKG-Restaurant mit dem Büffet, von
dem Kyoko erzählt hat!

English:
Aww, but they have a rice omelet meal as well!
...Mmmm...rice...omelet...!
Chinese:
可是蛋包飯定食感覺也很不錯！
嗯……蛋包飯……定食？
Korean:
그치만 그치만, 오므라이스 정식이라는 것도 좋네!
…잠깐… 오므라이스… 정식?
German:
Ach, aber es gibt auch ein Reisomelett-Gericht!
... Mmmh ... Reisomelett ...!

English:
All right, let's go inside. ...[p],
what do you want to order?
Chinese:
總之我們先進去吧。
[p]，你要點什麼？
Korean:
뭐, 아무튼 안으로 들어가자
…[p], 댁은 뭘 시킬 거야?
German:
Los, gehen wir rein. ... [p],
was willst du bestellen?

English:
(A teahouse? Cool, I like the retro feel of this
place.)
Chinese: （輕食咖啡啊……我不討厭這種復古的氣氛。）
Korean: (경식찻집인가… 이 복고풍 분위기 괜찮네)
German:
(Ein Teehaus? Cool. Mir gefällt die Atmosphäre
in diesem Laden ... So retro.)

English:
(The menu has so much on it...
I really can't choose!)
Chinese: （菜單還真是豐富……都要看得眼花繚亂了。）
Korean: (메뉴가 굉장히 풍부해… 뭘 시킬지 망설이게 된다)
German:
(Auf dem Menü stehen so viele Gerichte ...
Ich kann mich nicht entscheiden!)

English: (Huh?)
German: (Was?)

English: (Neapolitan pasta.)
Chinese: （拿波里義大利麵啊……）
Korean: (나폴리탄인가…)
German: (Pasta alla napoletana.)

English:
(Obviously the best pasta is from a pasta
restaurant, but I like this place...
Okay, I'll go for it!)
Chinese:
（雖然在義大利麵店吃的拿波里也不錯，但總覺得
　咖啡館端出的粗糙拿波里才是貨真價實……好，決定了！）
Korean:
(파스타집에서 먹는 나폴리탄도 좋지만 찻집이 내놓는
투박한 나폴리탄이야말로 진짜라는 느낌이 들어… 좋아, 정했다!)
German:
(Natürlich gibt es die beste Pasta in einem
italienischen Restaurant, aber mir gefällt dieses
Lokal. Okay, die nehme ich!)

English: Your Neapolitan sir, here you go!
Chinese: 拿波里義大利麵，讓您久等了！
Korean: ―나폴리탄, 오래 기다리셨습니다!
German: Pasta alla napoletana. Hier, bitte!

English:
(Nice, bright red tomato sauce on thick
spaghetti... Wow, this place really does good
Neapolitan pasta!)
Chinese:
（淋上鮮紅蕃茄醬的粗麵條……
　就是這個，這才是王道拿波里義大利麵。）
Korean:
(새빨간 케찹이 뿌려진 굵은 면…
이거야 이거, 이거야말로 왕도 나폴리탄이야)
German:
(Lecker, hellrote Tomatensoße auf dicken
Spaghetti ... Wow, dieser Laden macht echt gute
Pasta alla napoletana!)

English:
(And look at the chopped sausage on top...
I can't resist!)
Chinese:
（隨意切成片的香腸鋪在上面……
　不由得勾起了我的食慾……）
Korean:
(거기에 무작위로 잘려진 소시지가 올라가서…
이건 싫어도 식욕이 돋궈지는걸…)
German:
(Und dieses zerkleinerte Würstchen obendrauf ...
Unwiderstehlich!)

Korean: (호오…)

English:
(After the taste of the tomato sauce has gone, the
spice of the chili comes in strong. This is no
kids' dish! Mmm...not bad at all!)
Chinese:
（嚐到蕃茄醬的甜味後，隨之而來是朝天椒的辛辣，
　這就是大人的味道啊……嗯，不錯！）
Korean:
(케찹의 단맛 뒤에 타카노츠메의 매운 맛이 찌릿하게 와서
어른의 맛, 이란 느낌이려나… 응, 나쁘지 않아!)
German:
(Wenn der Geschmack der Tomatensoße nachlässt,
ist die Schärfe des Chilis zu spüren. Das ist
nichts für Kinder! Mmmh ... Nicht schlecht!)

English:
(Well, the thing about putting grated cheese on
top is, some people put it on before they start,
whereas I prefer to add it halfway through.)
Chinese:
（好了，問題是起司粉要什麼時候加下去……
有人會在吃前就灑，但我個人喜歡中途——）
Korean:
(그럼 문제는 가루 치즈를 언제 넣느냐군…
먹기 전에 뿌리는 사람도 있지만 개인적으로는 중간에 맛을―)
German:
(Was den geriebenen Käse obendrauf angeht,
manche Leute streuen ihn drauf, bevor sie anfangen
zu essen, ich dagegen, wenn ich halb fertig bin.)

English: That was delicious!
Chinese: 多謝款待！
Korean: 잘 먹었습니다아!
German: Das war köstlich!

English: Uff, I'm stuffed!
Chinese: 呼，太滿足了！！
Korean: 후우, 만족 만족!!
German: Uff, ich bin so voll!

English:
The price and taste are astonishingly good...
The range of foods on the menu is very wide...
Chinese:
令人震驚的價格與味道……
以及種類繁多的菜色選擇……
Korean:
충격적인 가격과 맛…
그리고 지나치게 폭넓은 라인업…
German:
Ich bin überrascht, wie günstig und lecker das
war. Die Auswahl an Gerichten auf der
Speisekarte war sehr vielfältig ...

English: Just what you'd expect from a Nakano restaurant.
Chinese: 真不愧是中野的店家啊。
Korean: 과연 나카노의 가게라는 느낌이네
German:
Wie man es von einem Restaurant in Nakano
erwartet.

English:
Yeah!
Looks like this place has a lot of regulars!
Chinese:
嗯！
而且感覺也有很多熟客！
Korean:
응!
단골인 것 같은 사람도 잔뜩 있었고!
German:
Ja!
Das Restaurant scheint viele Stammkunden zu haben!

English: Wow, you were really hungry today!
Chinese:
不過話說回來，
妳的胃也挺強的嘛。
Korean:
그건 그렇고
댁도 정말 튼튼한 위장을 가지고 있네
German: Wow, du hattest heute echt Hunger!

English:
That's the first time I have ever seen one single
human stomach take such a beating...
Chinese:
我還是第一次看到……
那麼多生蛋拌飯被吸進一個人類胃袋的景象。
Korean:
인간 한 명의 위장에 그렇게 많은 GGB가
빨려들어가는 모습… 처음 봤어
German:
Ich habe noch nie erlebt, dass ein einzelner
menschlicher Bauch so vollgeschlagen wurde ...

English: ...Did you write the report, [p]?
Chinese: 這篇食記是[p]寫的嗎？
Korean: …이 맛 감상, [p]가(이) 만든 건가?
German: ... Hast du den Bericht geschrieben, [p]?

English:
Yeah, the report is good but it's a pain in the
ass to read...
Chinese:
他寫得很好吧，
甚至到了有點囉唆的地步。
Korean:
꽤 잘 만들었군
왠지 좀 귀찮을 정도로
German: Ja, der Bericht ist gut, aber schwer zu lesen ...

English:
While we were eating, this guy just kept talking
to himself and never spoke a word to the rest of
us...
Chinese:
因為這傢伙一邊碎碎念，
一邊默默地吃……
Korean:
이 녀석, 뭔가 중얼거리면서
묵묵히 먹었었지…
German:
Während wir gegessen haben, hat unsere Spürnase
nur vor sich hingebrabbelt und nichts zu uns
gesagt ...

English:
Wow... I never thought you'd have such a talent
for writing reports...
Chinese: 嗯……人類真是有意想不到的才能。
Korean: 흐음… 사람에겐 생각지도 못한 재능이 있는 법이지
German:
Wow, ich hätte nie gedacht, dass du so ein Talent
für das Schreiben von Berichten hast ...

English:
So, by the way, who is this under-cover tester
client anyway?
Chinese:
對了杏子姊，
那個委託人「愛吃榜匿名評審員」是怎樣的人啊？
Korean:
있지 있지, 그런데 말야
의뢰인인「취미 랭킹 복면 심사원」은 어떤 사람이야?
German:
Wer ist denn überhaupt dieser geheime
Kritikerklient?

English:
He kept his true name hidden. I only know his Web
handle, so I don't actually know...
Chinese:
這畢竟是網路上發來的匿名委託……
所以委託人的事我也不清楚。
Korean:
어디까지나 익명인 WEB 상의 의뢰니까…
의뢰인은 나도 모른다
German:
Der wahre Name wurde nicht angegeben.
Ich kenne nur den Benutzernamen im Internet.
Ich weiß es also nicht ...

English:
And anyway, even if I knew, I have to keep that
information confidential, so I couldn't say...
Chinese:
而且就算我知道好了，
基於保密義務，我也無法回答妳。
Korean:
게다가 만약 알고 있다고 해도
묵비 의무가 있는 관계상 답해줄 수 없지만 말이지
German:
Und selbst wenn ich es wüsste, ist das
vertraulich und ich dürfte es nicht verraten ...

English:
Whaaaaa'!? Oh come on, Kyoko!
I really want to know!
Chinese:
什麼嘛！　杏子姊真小氣！
這樣不是叫人更在意了嗎！
Korean:
뭐어――! 쿄코 씨 치사해!
왠지 점점 더 신경 쓰이잖아!
German:
Waaas?! Komm schon, Kyoko!
Ich will es wirklich wissen!

English: This under-cover examiner...who the hell is he!?
Chinese:
愛吃榜匿名評審員……
不知道到底是怎樣的人……
Korean:
취미 랭킹 복면 심사원…
대체 어떤 사람인 걸까…
German: Dieser geheime Kritiker ... Wer ist es?!

English:
I think I'm done with this report.
Time to get it back to the office.
Chinese:
寫好令人滿意的食記了，
回事務所報告吧。
Korean:
만족할만한 맛 감상을 썼다
사무소에 보고하자
German:
Ich glaube, ich bin jetzt mit diesem Bericht
fertig. Ich sollte ihn ins Büro bringen.

English:
I can't fight on an empty stomach...
I'd better stuff myself to the gills now, then!
Chinese:
肚子餓了是無法打仗的……
先在館內大吃大喝一頓再說。
Korean:
배가 고프면 싸우지 못한다…
지금은 관내에서 놀고 먹자
German:
Kein Kampf ohne Mampf ...
Ich sollte mir jetzt lieber den Bauch
vollschlagen!

English:
Oh, no matter how talented an assistant you are,
it's useless investigating something so pointless.
Another case might come in.
Chinese:
就算你是再怎麼能幹的助手，
也不該問那些有的沒的。
愛吃榜匿名評審員……說不定還會再來委託我們呢。
Korean:
이런, 아무리 유능한 조수라 해도
쓸데없이 캐고들면 안 되지
취미 랭킹 복면 심사원… 또 의뢰가 올지도 모르겠군
German:
Egal, wie talentiert du als Hilfsdetektiv bist,
es bringt nichts, zu etwas so Sinnlosem zu
ermitteln. Vielleicht kommt ein neuer Fall rein.

English:
You must be ready to burst after all those
restaurants. How about some coffee? We can try a
new blend--Yuzukosho and sour cream!
Chinese:
跑了這麼多家店，想必你肚子一定很脹吧。
飯後來一杯咖啡怎麼樣？
我請你喝一杯用柚子胡椒和酸奶油全新調製的咖啡吧。
Korean:
많은 가게를 돌아서 분명 배가 불렀겠군
식후 커피는 어때?
유자후추와 사워 크림을 넣은 새 블렌드를 대접하도록 하지
German:
Nach all den Restaurants platzt du sicher bald.
Wie wäre es mit Kaffee? Wir können eine neue
Mischung probieren – Yuzukosho und saure Sahne!
